59#define LAST_SYSTEM_ERROR (::GetLastError())
60#elif defined(__native_client__) && __native_client__
61#define LAST_SYSTEM_ERROR (0)
62#elif defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
63#define LAST_SYSTEM_ERROR (errno)
64#endif // WEBRTC_WIN

66#if defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
67#include <netinet/tcp.h> // for TCP_NODELAY
68#define IP_MTU 14 // Until this is integrated from linux/in.h to netinet/in.h
69typedef void* SockOptArg;
70
71#endif // WEBRTC_POSIX

73#if defined(WEBRTC_POSIX) && !defined(WEBRTC_MAC) && !defined(__native_client__)
74
75int64_t GetSocketRecvTimestamp(int socket) {
76 struct timeval tv_ioctl;
77 int ret = ioctl(socket, SIOCGSTAMP, &tv_ioctl);
78 if (ret != 0)
79 return -1;
80 int64_t timestamp =
81 rtc::kNumMicrosecsPerSec * static_cast<int64_t>(tv_ioctl.tv_sec) +
82 static_cast<int64_t>(tv_ioctl.tv_usec);
83 return timestamp;
84}
85
86#else
87
88int64_t GetSocketRecvTimestamp(int socket) {
89 return -1;
90}
91#endif
92
93#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
94typedef char* SockOptArg;
95#endif
96
97#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
98// POLLRDHUP / EPOLLRDHUP are only defined starting with Linux 2.6.17.
99#if !defined(POLLRDHUP)
100#define POLLRDHUP 0x2000
101#endif
102#if !defined(EPOLLRDHUP)
103#define EPOLLRDHUP 0x2000
104#endif
105#endif

107namespace {
108class ScopedSetTrue {
109 public:
110 ScopedSetTrue(bool* value) : value_(value) {
111 RTC_DCHECK(!*value_);
112 *value_ = true;
113 }
114 ~ScopedSetTrue() { *value_ = false; }
115
116 private:
117 bool* value_;
118};
119} // namespace
120
121namespace rtc {
122
123PhysicalSocket::PhysicalSocket(PhysicalSocketServer* ss, SOCKET s)
124 : ss_(ss),
125 s_(s),
126 error_(0),
127 state_((s == INVALID_SOCKET) ? CS_CLOSED : CS_CONNECTED),
128 resolver_(nullptr) {
129 if (s_ != INVALID_SOCKET) {
130 SetEnabledEvents(DE_READ | DE_WRITE);
131
132 int type = SOCK_STREAM;
133 socklen_t len = sizeof(type);
134 const int res =
135 getsockopt(s_, SOL_SOCKET, SO_TYPE, (SockOptArg)&type, &len);
136 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(0, res);
137 udp_ = (SOCK_DGRAM == type);
138 }
139}
140
141PhysicalSocket::~PhysicalSocket() {
142 Close();
143}
144
145bool PhysicalSocket::Create(int family, int type) {
146 Close();
147 s_ = ::socket(family, type, 0);
148 udp_ = (SOCK_DGRAM == type);
149 family_ = family;
150 UpdateLastError();
151 if (udp_) {
152 SetEnabledEvents(DE_READ | DE_WRITE);
153 }
154 return s_ != INVALID_SOCKET;
155}
156
157SocketAddress PhysicalSocket::GetLocalAddress() const {
158 sockaddr_storage addr_storage = {};
159 socklen_t addrlen = sizeof(addr_storage);
160 sockaddr* addr = reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr_storage);
161 int result = ::getsockname(s_, addr, &addrlen);
162 SocketAddress address;
163 if (result >= 0) {
164 SocketAddressFromSockAddrStorage(addr_storage, &address);
165 } else {
166 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING) << "GetLocalAddress: unable to get local addr, socket="
167 << s_;
168 }
169 return address;
170}
171
172SocketAddress PhysicalSocket::GetRemoteAddress() const {
173 sockaddr_storage addr_storage = {};
174 socklen_t addrlen = sizeof(addr_storage);
175 sockaddr* addr = reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr_storage);
176 int result = ::getpeername(s_, addr, &addrlen);
177 SocketAddress address;
178 if (result >= 0) {
179 SocketAddressFromSockAddrStorage(addr_storage, &address);
180 } else {
181 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING)
182 << "GetRemoteAddress: unable to get remote addr, socket=" << s_;
183 }
184 return address;
185}
186
187int PhysicalSocket::Bind(const SocketAddress& bind_addr) {
188 SocketAddress copied_bind_addr = bind_addr;
189 // If a network binder is available, use it to bind a socket to an interface
190 // instead of bind(), since this is more reliable on an OS with a weak host
191 // model.
192 if (ss_->network_binder() && !bind_addr.IsAnyIP()) {
193 NetworkBindingResult result =
194 ss_->network_binder()->BindSocketToNetwork(s_, bind_addr.ipaddr());
195 if (result == NetworkBindingResult::SUCCESS) {
196 // Since the network binder handled binding the socket to the desired
197 // network interface, we don't need to (and shouldn't) include an IP in
198 // the bind() call; bind() just needs to assign a port.
199 copied_bind_addr.SetIP(GetAnyIP(copied_bind_addr.ipaddr().family()));
200 } else if (result == NetworkBindingResult::NOT_IMPLEMENTED) {
201 RTC_LOG(LS_INFO) << "Can't bind socket to network because "
202 "network binding is not implemented for this OS.";
203 } else {
204 if (bind_addr.IsLoopbackIP()) {
205 // If we couldn't bind to a loopback IP (which should only happen in
206 // test scenarios), continue on. This may be expected behavior.
207 RTC_LOG(LS_VERBOSE) << "Binding socket to loopback address"
208 << " failed; result: " << static_cast<int>(result);
209 } else {
210 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING) << "Binding socket to network address"
211 << " failed; result: " << static_cast<int>(result);
212 // If a network binding was attempted and failed, we should stop here
213 // and not try to use the socket. Otherwise, we may end up sending
214 // packets with an invalid source address.
215 // See: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/webrtc/issues/detail?id=7026
216 return -1;
217 }
218 }
219 }
220 sockaddr_storage addr_storage;
221 size_t len = copied_bind_addr.ToSockAddrStorage(&addr_storage);
222 sockaddr* addr = reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr_storage);
223 int err = ::bind(s_, addr, static_cast<int>(len));
224 UpdateLastError();
225#if !defined(NDEBUG)
226 if (0 == err) {
227 dbg_addr_ = "Bound @ ";
228 dbg_addr_.append(GetLocalAddress().ToString());
229 }
230#endif
231 return err;
232}
233
234int PhysicalSocket::Connect(const SocketAddress& addr) {
235 // TODO(pthatcher): Implicit creation is required to reconnect...
236 // ...but should we make it more explicit?
237 if (state_ != CS_CLOSED) {
238 SetError(EALREADY);
239 return SOCKET_ERROR;
240 }
241 if (addr.IsUnresolvedIP()) {
242 RTC_LOG(LS_VERBOSE) << "Resolving addr in PhysicalSocket::Connect";
243 resolver_ = new AsyncResolver();
244 resolver_->SignalDone.connect(this, &PhysicalSocket::OnResolveResult);
245 resolver_->Start(addr);
246 state_ = CS_CONNECTING;
247 return 0;
248 }
249
250 return DoConnect(addr);
251}
252
253int PhysicalSocket::DoConnect(const SocketAddress& connect_addr) {
254 if ((s_ == INVALID_SOCKET) && !Create(connect_addr.family(), SOCK_STREAM)) {
255 return SOCKET_ERROR;
256 }
257 sockaddr_storage addr_storage;
258 size_t len = connect_addr.ToSockAddrStorage(&addr_storage);
259 sockaddr* addr = reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr_storage);
260 int err = ::connect(s_, addr, static_cast<int>(len));
261 UpdateLastError();
262 uint8_t events = DE_READ | DE_WRITE;
263 if (err == 0) {
264 state_ = CS_CONNECTED;
265 } else if (IsBlockingError(GetError())) {
266 state_ = CS_CONNECTING;
267 events |= DE_CONNECT;
268 } else {
269 return SOCKET_ERROR;
270 }
271
272 EnableEvents(events);
273 return 0;
274}
275
276int PhysicalSocket::GetError() const {
277 webrtc::MutexLock lock(&mutex_);
278 return error_;
279}
280
281void PhysicalSocket::SetError(int error) {
282 webrtc::MutexLock lock(&mutex_);
283 error_ = error;
284}
285
286AsyncSocket::ConnState PhysicalSocket::GetState() const {
287 return state_;
288}
289
290int PhysicalSocket::GetOption(Option opt, int* value) {
291 int slevel;
292 int sopt;
293 if (TranslateOption(opt, &slevel, &sopt) == -1)
294 return -1;
295 socklen_t optlen = sizeof(*value);
296 int ret = ::getsockopt(s_, slevel, sopt, (SockOptArg)value, &optlen);
297 if (ret == -1) {
298 return -1;
299 }
300 if (opt == OPT_DONTFRAGMENT) {
301#if defined(WEBRTC_LINUX) && !defined(WEBRTC_ANDROID)
302 *value = (*value != IP_PMTUDISC_DONT) ? 1 : 0;
303#endif
304 } else if (opt == OPT_DSCP) {
305#if defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
306 // unshift DSCP value to get six most significant bits of IP DiffServ field
307 *value >>= 2;
308#endif
309 }
310 return ret;
311}
312
313int PhysicalSocket::SetOption(Option opt, int value) {
314 int slevel;
315 int sopt;
316 if (TranslateOption(opt, &slevel, &sopt) == -1)
317 return -1;
318 if (opt == OPT_DONTFRAGMENT) {
319#if defined(WEBRTC_LINUX) && !defined(WEBRTC_ANDROID)
320 value = (value) ? IP_PMTUDISC_DO : IP_PMTUDISC_DONT;
321#endif
322 } else if (opt == OPT_DSCP) {
323#if defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
324 // shift DSCP value to fit six most significant bits of IP DiffServ field
325 value <<= 2;
326#endif
327 }
328#if defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
329 if (sopt == IPV6_TCLASS) {
330 // Set the IPv4 option in all cases to support dual-stack sockets.
331 // Don't bother checking the return code, as this is expected to fail if
332 // it's not actually dual-stack.
333 ::setsockopt(s_, IPPROTO_IP, IP_TOS, (SockOptArg)&value, sizeof(value));
334 }
335#endif
336 int result =
337 ::setsockopt(s_, slevel, sopt, (SockOptArg)&value, sizeof(value));
338 if (result != 0) {
339 UpdateLastError();
340 }
341 return result;
342}
343
344int PhysicalSocket::Send(const void* pv, size_t cb) {
345 int sent = DoSend(
346 s_, reinterpret_cast<const char*>(pv), static_cast<int>(cb),
347#if defined(WEBRTC_LINUX) && !defined(WEBRTC_ANDROID)
348 // Suppress SIGPIPE. Without this, attempting to send on a socket whose
349 // other end is closed will result in a SIGPIPE signal being raised to
350 // our process, which by default will terminate the process, which we
351 // don't want. By specifying this flag, we'll just get the error EPIPE
352 // instead and can handle the error gracefully.
353 MSG_NOSIGNAL
354#else
355 0
356#endif
357 );
358 UpdateLastError();
359 MaybeRemapSendError();
360 // We have seen minidumps where this may be false.
361 RTC_DCHECK(sent <= static_cast<int>(cb));
362 if ((sent > 0 && sent < static_cast<int>(cb)) ||
363 (sent < 0 && IsBlockingError(GetError()))) {
364 EnableEvents(DE_WRITE);
365 }
366 return sent;
367}
368
369int PhysicalSocket::SendTo(const void* buffer,
370 size_t length,
371 const SocketAddress& addr) {
372 sockaddr_storage saddr;
373 size_t len = addr.ToSockAddrStorage(&saddr);
374 int sent =
375 DoSendTo(s_, static_cast<const char*>(buffer), static_cast<int>(length),
376#if defined(WEBRTC_LINUX) && !defined(WEBRTC_ANDROID)
377 // Suppress SIGPIPE. See above for explanation.
378 MSG_NOSIGNAL,
379#else
380 0,
381#endif
382 reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&saddr), static_cast<int>(len));
383 UpdateLastError();
384 MaybeRemapSendError();
385 // We have seen minidumps where this may be false.
386 RTC_DCHECK(sent <= static_cast<int>(length));
387 if ((sent > 0 && sent < static_cast<int>(length)) ||
388 (sent < 0 && IsBlockingError(GetError()))) {
389 EnableEvents(DE_WRITE);
390 }
391 return sent;
392}
393
394int PhysicalSocket::Recv(void* buffer, size_t length, int64_t* timestamp) {
395 int received =
396 ::recv(s_, static_cast<char*>(buffer), static_cast<int>(length), 0);
397 if ((received == 0) && (length != 0)) {
398 // Note: on graceful shutdown, recv can return 0. In this case, we
399 // pretend it is blocking, and then signal close, so that simplifying
400 // assumptions can be made about Recv.
401 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING) << "EOF from socket; deferring close event";
402 // Must turn this back on so that the select() loop will notice the close
403 // event.
404 EnableEvents(DE_READ);
405 SetError(EWOULDBLOCK);
406 return SOCKET_ERROR;
407 }
408 if (timestamp) {
409 *timestamp = GetSocketRecvTimestamp(s_);
410 }
411 UpdateLastError();
412 int error = GetError();
413 bool success = (received >= 0) || IsBlockingError(error);
414 if (udp_ || success) {
415 EnableEvents(DE_READ);
416 }
417 if (!success) {
418 RTC_LOG_F(LS_VERBOSE) << "Error = " << error;
419 }
420 return received;
421}
422
423int PhysicalSocket::RecvFrom(void* buffer,
424 size_t length,
425 SocketAddress* out_addr,
426 int64_t* timestamp) {
427 sockaddr_storage addr_storage;
428 socklen_t addr_len = sizeof(addr_storage);
429 sockaddr* addr = reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr_storage);
430 int received = ::recvfrom(s_, static_cast<char*>(buffer),
431 static_cast<int>(length), 0, addr, &addr_len);
432 if (timestamp) {
433 *timestamp = GetSocketRecvTimestamp(s_);
434 }
435 UpdateLastError();
436 if ((received >= 0) && (out_addr != nullptr))
437 SocketAddressFromSockAddrStorage(addr_storage, out_addr);
438 int error = GetError();
439 bool success = (received >= 0) || IsBlockingError(error);
440 if (udp_ || success) {
441 EnableEvents(DE_READ);
442 }
443 if (!success) {
444 RTC_LOG_F(LS_VERBOSE) << "Error = " << error;
445 }
446 return received;
447}
448
449int PhysicalSocket::Listen(int backlog) {
450 int err = ::listen(s_, backlog);
451 UpdateLastError();
452 if (err == 0) {
453 state_ = CS_CONNECTING;
454 EnableEvents(DE_ACCEPT);
455#if !defined(NDEBUG)
456 dbg_addr_ = "Listening @ ";
457 dbg_addr_.append(GetLocalAddress().ToString());
458#endif
459 }
460 return err;
461}
462
463AsyncSocket* PhysicalSocket::Accept(SocketAddress* out_addr) {
464 // Always re-subscribe DE_ACCEPT to make sure new incoming connections will
465 // trigger an event even if DoAccept returns an error here.
466 EnableEvents(DE_ACCEPT);
467 sockaddr_storage addr_storage;
468 socklen_t addr_len = sizeof(addr_storage);
469 sockaddr* addr = reinterpret_cast<sockaddr*>(&addr_storage);
470 SOCKET s = DoAccept(s_, addr, &addr_len);
471 UpdateLastError();
472 if (s == INVALID_SOCKET)
473 return nullptr;
474 if (out_addr != nullptr)
475 SocketAddressFromSockAddrStorage(addr_storage, out_addr);
476 return ss_->WrapSocket(s);
477}
478
479int PhysicalSocket::Close() {
480 if (s_ == INVALID_SOCKET)
481 return 0;
482 int err = ::closesocket(s_);
483 UpdateLastError();
484 s_ = INVALID_SOCKET;
485 state_ = CS_CLOSED;
486 SetEnabledEvents(0);
487 if (resolver_) {
488 resolver_->Destroy(false);
489 resolver_ = nullptr;
490 }
491 return err;
492}
493
494SOCKET PhysicalSocket::DoAccept(SOCKET socket,
495 sockaddr* addr,
496 socklen_t* addrlen) {
497 return ::accept(socket, addr, addrlen);
498}
499
500int PhysicalSocket::DoSend(SOCKET socket, const char* buf, int len, int flags) {
501 return ::send(socket, buf, len, flags);
502}
503
504int PhysicalSocket::DoSendTo(SOCKET socket,
505 const char* buf,
506 int len,
507 int flags,
508 const struct sockaddr* dest_addr,
509 socklen_t addrlen) {
510 return ::sendto(socket, buf, len, flags, dest_addr, addrlen);
511}
512
513void PhysicalSocket::OnResolveResult(AsyncResolverInterface* resolver) {
514 if (resolver != resolver_) {
515 return;
516 }
517
518 int error = resolver_->GetError();
519 if (error == 0) {
520 error = DoConnect(resolver_->address());
521 } else {
522 Close();
523 }
524
525 if (error) {
526 SetError(error);
527 SignalCloseEvent(this, error);
528 }
529}
530
531void PhysicalSocket::UpdateLastError() {
532 SetError(LAST_SYSTEM_ERROR);
533}
534
535void PhysicalSocket::MaybeRemapSendError() {
536#if defined(WEBRTC_MAC)
537 // https://developer.apple.com/library/mac/documentation/Darwin/
538 // Reference/ManPages/man2/sendto.2.html
539 // ENOBUFS - The output queue for a network interface is full.
540 // This generally indicates that the interface has stopped sending,
541 // but may be caused by transient congestion.
542 if (GetError() == ENOBUFS) {
543 SetError(EWOULDBLOCK);
544 }
545#endif
546}
547
548void PhysicalSocket::SetEnabledEvents(uint8_t events) {
549 enabled_events_ = events;
550}
551
552void PhysicalSocket::EnableEvents(uint8_t events) {
553 enabled_events_ |= events;
554}
555
556void PhysicalSocket::DisableEvents(uint8_t events) {
557 enabled_events_ &= ~events;
558}
559
560int PhysicalSocket::TranslateOption(Option opt, int* slevel, int* sopt) {
561 switch (opt) {
562 case OPT_DONTFRAGMENT:
563#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
564 *slevel = IPPROTO_IP;
565 *sopt = IP_DONTFRAGMENT;
566 break;
567#elif defined(WEBRTC_MAC) || defined(BSD) || defined(__native_client__)
568 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING) << "Socket::OPT_DONTFRAGMENT not supported.";
569 return -1;
570#elif defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
571 *slevel = IPPROTO_IP;
572 *sopt = IP_MTU_DISCOVER;
573 break;
574#endif
575 case OPT_RCVBUF:
576 *slevel = SOL_SOCKET;
577 *sopt = SO_RCVBUF;
578 break;
579 case OPT_SNDBUF:
580 *slevel = SOL_SOCKET;
581 *sopt = SO_SNDBUF;
582 break;
583 case OPT_NODELAY:
584 *slevel = IPPROTO_TCP;
585 *sopt = TCP_NODELAY;
586 break;
587 case OPT_DSCP:
588#if defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
589 if (family_ == AF_INET6) {
590 *slevel = IPPROTO_IPV6;
591 *sopt = IPV6_TCLASS;
592 } else {
593 *slevel = IPPROTO_IP;
594 *sopt = IP_TOS;
595 }
596 break;
597#else
598 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING) << "Socket::OPT_DSCP not supported.";
599 return -1;
600#endif
601 case OPT_RTP_SENDTIME_EXTN_ID:
602 return -1; // No logging is necessary as this not a OS socket option.
603 default:
604 RTC_NOTREACHED();
605 return -1;
606 }
607 return 0;
608}
609
610SocketDispatcher::SocketDispatcher(PhysicalSocketServer* ss)
611#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
612 : PhysicalSocket(ss),
613 id_(0),
614 signal_close_(false)
615#else
616 : PhysicalSocket(ss)
617#endif
618{
619}
620
621SocketDispatcher::SocketDispatcher(SOCKET s, PhysicalSocketServer* ss)
622#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
623 : PhysicalSocket(ss, s),
624 id_(0),
625 signal_close_(false)
626#else
627 : PhysicalSocket(ss, s)
628#endif
629{
630}
631
632SocketDispatcher::~SocketDispatcher() {
633 Close();
634}
635
636bool SocketDispatcher::Initialize() {
637 RTC_DCHECK(s_ != INVALID_SOCKET);
638#if defined(WEBRTC_WEBKIT_BUILD)
639 if (s_ < 0 || s_ >= FD_SETSIZE) {
640 RTC_LOG_ERR(LS_ERROR) << "SocketDispatcher::Initialize, file descriptor is invalid";
641 return false;
642 }
643#endif
644// Must be a non-blocking
645#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
646 u_long argp = 1;
647 ioctlsocket(s_, FIONBIO, &argp);
648#elif defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
649 fcntl(s_, F_SETFL, fcntl(s_, F_GETFL, 0) | O_NONBLOCK);
650#endif
651#if defined(WEBRTC_IOS) || (defined(WEBRTC_MAC) && defined(WEBRTC_WEBKIT_BUILD))
652 // iOS may kill sockets when the app is moved to the background
653 // (specifically, if the app doesn't use the "voip" UIBackgroundMode). When
654 // we attempt to write to such a socket, SIGPIPE will be raised, which by
655 // default will terminate the process, which we don't want. By specifying
656 // this socket option, SIGPIPE will be disabled for the socket.
657 int value = 1;
658 ::setsockopt(s_, SOL_SOCKET, SO_NOSIGPIPE, &value, sizeof(value));
659#endif
660 ss_->Add(this);
661 return true;
662}
663
664bool SocketDispatcher::Create(int type) {
665 return Create(AF_INET, type);
666}
667
668bool SocketDispatcher::Create(int family, int type) {
669 // Change the socket to be non-blocking.
670 if (!PhysicalSocket::Create(family, type))
671 return false;
672
673 if (!Initialize())
674 return false;
675
676#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
677 do {
678 id_ = ++next_id_;
679 } while (id_ == 0);
680#endif
681 return true;
682}
683
684#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
685
686WSAEVENT SocketDispatcher::GetWSAEvent() {
687 return WSA_INVALID_EVENT;
688}
689
690SOCKET SocketDispatcher::GetSocket() {
691 return s_;
692}
693
694bool SocketDispatcher::CheckSignalClose() {
695 if (!signal_close_)
696 return false;
697
698 char ch;
699 if (recv(s_, &ch, 1, MSG_PEEK) > 0)
700 return false;
701
702 state_ = CS_CLOSED;
703 signal_close_ = false;
704 SignalCloseEvent(this, signal_err_);
705 return true;
706}
707
708int SocketDispatcher::next_id_ = 0;
709
710#elif defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
711
712int SocketDispatcher::GetDescriptor() {
713 return s_;
714}
715
716bool SocketDispatcher::IsDescriptorClosed() {
717 if (udp_) {
718 // The MSG_PEEK trick doesn't work for UDP, since (at least in some
719 // circumstances) it requires reading an entire UDP packet, which would be
720 // bad for performance here. So, just check whether |s_| has been closed,
721 // which should be sufficient.
722 return s_ == INVALID_SOCKET;
723 }
724 // We don't have a reliable way of distinguishing end-of-stream
725 // from readability. So test on each readable call. Is this
726 // inefficient? Probably.
727 char ch;
728 ssize_t res = ::recv(s_, &ch, 1, MSG_PEEK);
729 if (res > 0) {
730 // Data available, so not closed.
731 return false;
732 } else if (res == 0) {
733 // EOF, so closed.
734 return true;
735 } else { // error
736 switch (errno) {
737 // Returned if we've already closed s_.
738 case EBADF:
739 // Returned during ungraceful peer shutdown.
740 case ECONNRESET:
741 return true;
742 // The normal blocking error; don't log anything.
743 case EWOULDBLOCK:
744 // Interrupted system call.
745 case EINTR:
746 return false;
747 default:
748 // Assume that all other errors are just blocking errors, meaning the
749 // connection is still good but we just can't read from it right now.
750 // This should only happen when connecting (and at most once), because
751 // in all other cases this function is only called if the file
752 // descriptor is already known to be in the readable state. However,
753 // it's not necessary a problem if we spuriously interpret a
754 // "connection lost"-type error as a blocking error, because typically
755 // the next recv() will get EOF, so we'll still eventually notice that
756 // the socket is closed.
757 RTC_LOG_ERR(LS_WARNING) << "Assuming benign blocking error";
758 return false;
759 }
760 }
761}
762
763#endif // WEBRTC_POSIX
764
765uint32_t SocketDispatcher::GetRequestedEvents() {
766 return enabled_events();
767}
768
769#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
770
771void SocketDispatcher::OnEvent(uint32_t ff, int err) {
772 if ((ff & DE_CONNECT) != 0)
773 state_ = CS_CONNECTED;
774
775 // We set CS_CLOSED from CheckSignalClose.
776
777 int cache_id = id_;
778 // Make sure we deliver connect/accept first. Otherwise, consumers may see
779 // something like a READ followed by a CONNECT, which would be odd.
780 if (((ff & DE_CONNECT) != 0) && (id_ == cache_id)) {
781 if (ff != DE_CONNECT)
782 RTC_LOG(LS_VERBOSE) << "Signalled with DE_CONNECT: " << ff;
783 DisableEvents(DE_CONNECT);
784#if !defined(NDEBUG)
785 dbg_addr_ = "Connected @ ";
786 dbg_addr_.append(GetRemoteAddress().ToString());
787#endif
788 SignalConnectEvent(this);
789 }
790 if (((ff & DE_ACCEPT) != 0) && (id_ == cache_id)) {
791 DisableEvents(DE_ACCEPT);
792 SignalReadEvent(this);
793 }
794 if ((ff & DE_READ) != 0) {
795 DisableEvents(DE_READ);
796 SignalReadEvent(this);
797 }
798 if (((ff & DE_WRITE) != 0) && (id_ == cache_id)) {
799 DisableEvents(DE_WRITE);
800 SignalWriteEvent(this);
801 }
802 if (((ff & DE_CLOSE) != 0) && (id_ == cache_id)) {
803 signal_close_ = true;
804 signal_err_ = err;
805 }
806}
807
808#elif defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
809
810void SocketDispatcher::OnEvent(uint32_t ff, int err) {
811 if ((ff & DE_CONNECT) != 0)
812 state_ = CS_CONNECTED;
813
814 if ((ff & DE_CLOSE) != 0)
815 state_ = CS_CLOSED;
816
817#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
818 // Remember currently enabled events so we can combine multiple changes
819 // into one update call later.
820 // The signal handlers might re-enable events disabled here, so we can't
821 // keep a list of events to disable at the end of the method. This list
822 // would not be updated with the events enabled by the signal handlers.
823 StartBatchedEventUpdates();
824#endif
825 // Make sure we deliver connect/accept first. Otherwise, consumers may see
826 // something like a READ followed by a CONNECT, which would be odd.
827 if ((ff & DE_CONNECT) != 0) {
828 DisableEvents(DE_CONNECT);
829 SignalConnectEvent(this);
830 }
831 if ((ff & DE_ACCEPT) != 0) {
832 DisableEvents(DE_ACCEPT);
833 SignalReadEvent(this);
834 }
835 if ((ff & DE_READ) != 0) {
836 DisableEvents(DE_READ);
837 SignalReadEvent(this);
838 }
839 if ((ff & DE_WRITE) != 0) {
840 DisableEvents(DE_WRITE);
841 SignalWriteEvent(this);
842 }
843 if ((ff & DE_CLOSE) != 0) {
844 // The socket is now dead to us, so stop checking it.
845 SetEnabledEvents(0);
846 SignalCloseEvent(this, err);
847 }
848#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
849 FinishBatchedEventUpdates();
850#endif
851}
852
853#endif // WEBRTC_POSIX
854
855#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
856
857inline static int GetEpollEvents(uint32_t ff) {
858 int events = 0;
859 if (ff & (DE_READ | DE_ACCEPT)) {
860 events |= EPOLLIN;
861 }
862 if (ff & (DE_WRITE | DE_CONNECT)) {
863 events |= EPOLLOUT;
864 }
865 return events;
866}
867
868void SocketDispatcher::StartBatchedEventUpdates() {
869 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(saved_enabled_events_, -1);
870 saved_enabled_events_ = enabled_events();
871}
872
873void SocketDispatcher::FinishBatchedEventUpdates() {
874 RTC_DCHECK_NE(saved_enabled_events_, -1);
875 uint8_t old_events = static_cast<uint8_t>(saved_enabled_events_);
876 saved_enabled_events_ = -1;
877 MaybeUpdateDispatcher(old_events);
878}
879
880void SocketDispatcher::MaybeUpdateDispatcher(uint8_t old_events) {
881 if (GetEpollEvents(enabled_events()) != GetEpollEvents(old_events) &&
882 saved_enabled_events_ == -1) {
883 ss_->Update(this);
884 }
885}
886
887void SocketDispatcher::SetEnabledEvents(uint8_t events) {
888 uint8_t old_events = enabled_events();
889 PhysicalSocket::SetEnabledEvents(events);
890 MaybeUpdateDispatcher(old_events);
891}
892
893void SocketDispatcher::EnableEvents(uint8_t events) {
894 uint8_t old_events = enabled_events();
895 PhysicalSocket::EnableEvents(events);
896 MaybeUpdateDispatcher(old_events);
897}
898
899void SocketDispatcher::DisableEvents(uint8_t events) {
900 uint8_t old_events = enabled_events();
901 PhysicalSocket::DisableEvents(events);
902 MaybeUpdateDispatcher(old_events);
903}
904
905#endif // WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL
906
907int SocketDispatcher::Close() {
908 if (s_ == INVALID_SOCKET)
909 return 0;
910
911#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
912 id_ = 0;
913 signal_close_ = false;
914#endif
915#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
916 // If we're batching events, the socket can be closed and reopened
917 // during the batch. Set saved_enabled_events_ to 0 here so the new
918 // socket, if any, has the correct old events bitfield
919 if (saved_enabled_events_ != -1) {
920 saved_enabled_events_ = 0;
921 }
922#endif
923 ss_->Remove(this);
924 return PhysicalSocket::Close();
925}
926
927#if defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
928// Sets the value of a boolean value to false when signaled.
929class Signaler : public Dispatcher {
930 public:
931 Signaler(PhysicalSocketServer* ss, bool& flag_to_clear)
932 : ss_(ss),
933 afd_([] {
934 std::array<int, 2> afd = {-1, -1};
935
936 if (pipe(afd.data()) < 0) {
937 RTC_LOG(LERROR) << "pipe failed";
938 }
939 return afd;
940 }()),
941 fSignaled_(false),
942 flag_to_clear_(flag_to_clear) {
943 ss_->Add(this);
944 }
945
946 ~Signaler() override {
947 ss_->Remove(this);
948 close(afd_[0]);
949 close(afd_[1]);
950 }
951
952 virtual void Signal() {
953 webrtc::MutexLock lock(&mutex_);
954 if (!fSignaled_) {
955 const uint8_t b[1] = {0};
956 const ssize_t res = write(afd_[1], b, sizeof(b));
957 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(1, res);
958 fSignaled_ = true;
959 }
960 }
961
962 uint32_t GetRequestedEvents() override { return DE_READ; }
963
964 void OnEvent(uint32_t ff, int err) override {
965 // It is not possible to perfectly emulate an auto-resetting event with
966 // pipes. This simulates it by resetting before the event is handled.
967
968 webrtc::MutexLock lock(&mutex_);
969 if (fSignaled_) {
970 uint8_t b[4]; // Allow for reading more than 1 byte, but expect 1.
971 const ssize_t res = read(afd_[0], b, sizeof(b));
972 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(1, res);
973 fSignaled_ = false;
974 }
975 flag_to_clear_ = false;
976 }
977
978 int GetDescriptor() override { return afd_[0]; }
979
980 bool IsDescriptorClosed() override { return false; }
981
982 private:
983 PhysicalSocketServer* const ss_;
984 const std::array<int, 2> afd_;
985 bool fSignaled_ RTC_GUARDED_BY(mutex_);
986 webrtc::Mutex mutex_;
987 bool& flag_to_clear_;
988};
989
990#endif // WEBRTC_POSIX
991
992#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
993static uint32_t FlagsToEvents(uint32_t events) {
994 uint32_t ffFD = FD_CLOSE;
995 if (events & DE_READ)
996 ffFD |= FD_READ;
997 if (events & DE_WRITE)
998 ffFD |= FD_WRITE;
999 if (events & DE_CONNECT)
1000 ffFD |= FD_CONNECT;
1001 if (events & DE_ACCEPT)
1002 ffFD |= FD_ACCEPT;
1003 return ffFD;
1004}
1005
1006// Sets the value of a boolean value to false when signaled.
1007class Signaler : public Dispatcher {
1008 public:
1009 Signaler(PhysicalSocketServer* ss, bool& flag_to_clear)
1010 : ss_(ss), flag_to_clear_(flag_to_clear) {
1011 hev_ = WSACreateEvent();
1012 if (hev_) {
1013 ss_->Add(this);
1014 }
1015 }
1016
1017 ~Signaler() override {
1018 if (hev_ != nullptr) {
1019 ss_->Remove(this);
1020 WSACloseEvent(hev_);
1021 hev_ = nullptr;
1022 }
1023 }
1024
1025 virtual void Signal() {
1026 if (hev_ != nullptr)
1027 WSASetEvent(hev_);
1028 }
1029
1030 uint32_t GetRequestedEvents() override { return 0; }
1031
1032 void OnEvent(uint32_t ff, int err) override {
1033 WSAResetEvent(hev_);
1034 flag_to_clear_ = false;
1035 }
1036
1037 WSAEVENT GetWSAEvent() override { return hev_; }
1038
1039 SOCKET GetSocket() override { return INVALID_SOCKET; }
1040
1041 bool CheckSignalClose() override { return false; }
1042
1043 private:
1044 PhysicalSocketServer* ss_;
1045 WSAEVENT hev_;
1046 bool& flag_to_clear_;
1047};
1048#endif // WEBRTC_WIN
1049
1050PhysicalSocketServer::PhysicalSocketServer()
1051 :
1052#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
1053 // Since Linux 2.6.8, the size argument is ignored, but must be greater
1054 // than zero. Before that the size served as hint to the kernel for the
1055 // amount of space to initially allocate in internal data structures.
1056 epoll_fd_(epoll_create(FD_SETSIZE)),
1057#endif
1058#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
1059 socket_ev_(WSACreateEvent()),
1060#endif
1061 fWait_(false) {
1062#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
1063 if (epoll_fd_ == -1) {
1064 // Not an error, will fall back to "select" below.
1065 RTC_LOG_E(LS_WARNING, EN, errno) << "epoll_create";
1066 // Note that -1 == INVALID_SOCKET, the alias used by later checks.
1067 }
1068#endif
1069 // The `fWait_` flag to be cleared by the Signaler.
1070 signal_wakeup_ = new Signaler(this, fWait_);
1071}
1072
1073PhysicalSocketServer::~PhysicalSocketServer() {
1074#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
1075 WSACloseEvent(socket_ev_);
1076#endif
1077 delete signal_wakeup_;
1078#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
1079 if (epoll_fd_ != INVALID_SOCKET) {
1080 close(epoll_fd_);
1081 }
1082#endif
1083 RTC_DCHECK(dispatcher_by_key_.empty());
1084 RTC_DCHECK(key_by_dispatcher_.empty());
1085}
1086
1087void PhysicalSocketServer::WakeUp() {
1088 signal_wakeup_->Signal();
1089}
1090
1091Socket* PhysicalSocketServer::CreateSocket(int family, int type) {
1092 PhysicalSocket* socket = new PhysicalSocket(this);
1093 if (socket->Create(family, type)) {
1094 return socket;
1095 } else {
1096 delete socket;
1097 return nullptr;
1098 }
1099}
1100
1101AsyncSocket* PhysicalSocketServer::CreateAsyncSocket(int family, int type) {
1102 SocketDispatcher* dispatcher = new SocketDispatcher(this);
1103 if (dispatcher->Create(family, type)) {
1104 return dispatcher;
1105 } else {
1106 delete dispatcher;
1107 return nullptr;
1108 }
1109}
1110
1111AsyncSocket* PhysicalSocketServer::WrapSocket(SOCKET s) {
1112 SocketDispatcher* dispatcher = new SocketDispatcher(s, this);
1113 if (dispatcher->Initialize()) {
1114 return dispatcher;
1115 } else {
1116 delete dispatcher;
1117 return nullptr;
1118 }
1119}
1120
1121void PhysicalSocketServer::Add(Dispatcher* pdispatcher) {
1122 CritScope cs(&crit_);
1123 if (key_by_dispatcher_.count(pdispatcher)) {
1124 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING)
1125 << "PhysicalSocketServer asked to add a duplicate dispatcher.";
1126 return;
1127 }
1128 uint64_t key = next_dispatcher_key_++;
1129 dispatcher_by_key_.emplace(key, pdispatcher);
1130 key_by_dispatcher_.emplace(pdispatcher, key);
1131#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
1132 if (epoll_fd_ != INVALID_SOCKET) {
1133 AddEpoll(pdispatcher, key);
1134 }
1135#endif // WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL
1136}
1137
1138void PhysicalSocketServer::Remove(Dispatcher* pdispatcher) {
1139 CritScope cs(&crit_);
1140 if (!key_by_dispatcher_.count(pdispatcher)) {
1141 RTC_LOG(LS_WARNING)
1142 << "PhysicalSocketServer asked to remove a unknown "
1143 "dispatcher, potentially from a duplicate call to Add.";
1144 return;
1145 }
1146 uint64_t key = key_by_dispatcher_.at(pdispatcher);
1147 key_by_dispatcher_.erase(pdispatcher);
1148 dispatcher_by_key_.erase(key);
1149#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
1150 if (epoll_fd_ != INVALID_SOCKET) {
1151 RemoveEpoll(pdispatcher);
1152 }
1153#endif // WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL
1154}
1155
1156void PhysicalSocketServer::Update(Dispatcher* pdispatcher) {
1157#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
1158 if (epoll_fd_ == INVALID_SOCKET) {
1159 return;
1160 }
1161
1162 // Don't update dispatchers that haven't yet been added.
1163 CritScope cs(&crit_);
1164 if (!key_by_dispatcher_.count(pdispatcher)) {
1165 return;
1166 }
1167
1168 UpdateEpoll(pdispatcher, key_by_dispatcher_.at(pdispatcher));
1169#endif
1170}
1171
1172#if defined(WEBRTC_POSIX)
1173
1174bool PhysicalSocketServer::Wait(int cmsWait, bool process_io) {
1175 // We don't support reentrant waiting.
1176 RTC_DCHECK(!waiting_);
1177 ScopedSetTrue s(&waiting_);
1178#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
1179 // We don't keep a dedicated "epoll" descriptor containing only the non-IO
1180 // (i.e. signaling) dispatcher, so "poll" will be used instead of the default
1181 // "select" to support sockets larger than FD_SETSIZE.
1182 if (!process_io) {
1183 return WaitPoll(cmsWait, signal_wakeup_);
1184 } else if (epoll_fd_ != INVALID_SOCKET) {
1185 return WaitEpoll(cmsWait);
1186 }
1187#endif
1188 return WaitSelect(cmsWait, process_io);
1189}
1190
1191static void ProcessEvents(Dispatcher* dispatcher,
1192 bool readable,
1193 bool writable,
1194 bool check_error) {
1195 int errcode = 0;
1196 // TODO(pthatcher): Should we set errcode if getsockopt fails?
1197 if (check_error) {
1198 socklen_t len = sizeof(errcode);
1199 ::getsockopt(dispatcher->GetDescriptor(), SOL_SOCKET, SO_ERROR, &errcode,
1200 &len);
1201 }
1202
1203 // Most often the socket is writable or readable or both, so make a single
1204 // virtual call to get requested events
1205 const uint32_t requested_events = dispatcher->GetRequestedEvents();
1206 uint32_t ff = 0;
1207
1208 // Check readable descriptors. If we're waiting on an accept, signal
1209 // that. Otherwise we're waiting for data, check to see if we're
1210 // readable or really closed.
1211 // TODO(pthatcher): Only peek at TCP descriptors.
1212 if (readable) {
1213 if (requested_events & DE_ACCEPT) {
1214 ff |= DE_ACCEPT;
1215 } else if (errcode || dispatcher->IsDescriptorClosed()) {
1216 ff |= DE_CLOSE;
1217 } else {
1218 ff |= DE_READ;
1219 }
1220 }
1221
1222 // Check writable descriptors. If we're waiting on a connect, detect
1223 // success versus failure by the reaped error code.
1224 if (writable) {
1225 if (requested_events & DE_CONNECT) {
1226 if (!errcode) {
1227 ff |= DE_CONNECT;
1228 } else {
1229 ff |= DE_CLOSE;
1230 }
1231 } else {
1232 ff |= DE_WRITE;
1233 }
1234 }
1235
1236 // Tell the descriptor about the event.
1237 if (ff != 0) {
1238 dispatcher->OnEvent(ff, errcode);
1239 }
1240}
1241
1242bool PhysicalSocketServer::WaitSelect(int cmsWait, bool process_io) {
1243 // Calculate timing information
1244
1245 struct timeval* ptvWait = nullptr;
1246 struct timeval tvWait;
1247 int64_t stop_us;
1248 if (cmsWait != kForever) {
1249 // Calculate wait timeval
1250 tvWait.tv_sec = cmsWait / 1000;
1251 tvWait.tv_usec = (cmsWait % 1000) * 1000;
1252 ptvWait = &tvWait;
1253
1254 // Calculate when to return
1255 stop_us = rtc::TimeMicros() + cmsWait * 1000;
1256 }
1257
1258
1259 fd_set fdsRead;
1260 fd_set fdsWrite;
1261// Explicitly unpoison these FDs on MemorySanitizer which doesn't handle the
1262// inline assembly in FD_ZERO.
1263// http://crbug.com/344505
1264#ifdef MEMORY_SANITIZER
1265 __msan_unpoison(&fdsRead, sizeof(fdsRead));
1266 __msan_unpoison(&fdsWrite, sizeof(fdsWrite));
1267#endif
1268
1269 fWait_ = true;
1270
1271 while (fWait_) {
1272 // Zero all fd_sets. Although select() zeros the descriptors not signaled,
1273 // we may need to do this for dispatchers that were deleted while
1274 // iterating.
1275 FD_ZERO(&fdsRead);
1276 FD_ZERO(&fdsWrite);
1277 int fdmax = -1;
1278 {
1279 CritScope cr(&crit_);
1280 current_dispatcher_keys_.clear();
1281 for (auto const& kv : dispatcher_by_key_) {
1282 uint64_t key = kv.first;
1283 Dispatcher* pdispatcher = kv.second;
1284 // Query dispatchers for read and write wait state
1285 if (!process_io && (pdispatcher != signal_wakeup_))
1286 continue;
1287 current_dispatcher_keys_.push_back(key);
1288 int fd = pdispatcher->GetDescriptor();
1289 // "select"ing a file descriptor that is equal to or larger than
1290 // FD_SETSIZE will result in undefined behavior.
1291 RTC_DCHECK_LT(fd, FD_SETSIZE);
1292#if defined(WEBRTC_WEBKIT_BUILD)
1293 if (fd < 0 || fd >= FD_SETSIZE) {
1294 RTC_LOG_ERR(LS_ERROR) << "PhysicalSocketServer::WaitSelect, selecting a file descriptor that is invalid";
1295 continue;
1296 }
1297#endif
1298 if (fd > fdmax)
1299 fdmax = fd;
1300
1301 uint32_t ff = pdispatcher->GetRequestedEvents();
1302 if (ff & (DE_READ | DE_ACCEPT))
1303 FD_SET(fd, &fdsRead);
1304 if (ff & (DE_WRITE | DE_CONNECT))
1305 FD_SET(fd, &fdsWrite);
1306 }
1307 }
1308
1309 // Wait then call handlers as appropriate
1310 // < 0 means error
1311 // 0 means timeout
1312 // > 0 means count of descriptors ready
1313 int n = select(fdmax + 1, &fdsRead, &fdsWrite, nullptr, ptvWait);
1314
1315 // If error, return error.
1316 if (n < 0) {
1317 if (errno != EINTR) {
1318 RTC_LOG_E(LS_ERROR, EN, errno) << "select";
1319 return false;
1320 }
1321 // Else ignore the error and keep going. If this EINTR was for one of the
1322 // signals managed by this PhysicalSocketServer, the
1323 // PosixSignalDeliveryDispatcher will be in the signaled state in the next
1324 // iteration.
1325 } else if (n == 0) {
1326 // If timeout, return success
1327 return true;
1328 } else {
1329 // We have signaled descriptors
1330 CritScope cr(&crit_);
1331 // Iterate only on the dispatchers whose sockets were passed into
1332 // WSAEventSelect; this avoids the ABA problem (a socket being
1333 // destroyed and a new one created with the same file descriptor).
1334 for (uint64_t key : current_dispatcher_keys_) {
1335 if (!dispatcher_by_key_.count(key))
1336 continue;
1337 Dispatcher* pdispatcher = dispatcher_by_key_.at(key);
1338
1339 int fd = pdispatcher->GetDescriptor();
1340
1341#if defined(WEBRTC_WEBKIT_BUILD)
1342 if (fd < 0 || fd >= FD_SETSIZE) {
1343 RTC_LOG_ERR(LS_ERROR) << "PhysicalSocketServer::WaitSelect, signaled file descriptor is invalid";
1344 continue;
1345 }
1346#endif
1347
1348 bool readable = FD_ISSET(fd, &fdsRead);
1349 if (readable) {
1350 FD_CLR(fd, &fdsRead);
1351 }
1352
1353 bool writable = FD_ISSET(fd, &fdsWrite);
1354 if (writable) {
1355 FD_CLR(fd, &fdsWrite);
1356 }
1357
1358 // The error code can be signaled through reads or writes.
1359 ProcessEvents(pdispatcher, readable, writable, readable || writable);
1360 }
1361 }
1362
1363 // Recalc the time remaining to wait. Doing it here means it doesn't get
1364 // calced twice the first time through the loop
1365 if (ptvWait) {
1366 ptvWait->tv_sec = 0;
1367 ptvWait->tv_usec = 0;
1368 int64_t time_left_us = stop_us - rtc::TimeMicros();
1369 if (time_left_us > 0) {
1370 ptvWait->tv_sec = time_left_us / rtc::kNumMicrosecsPerSec;
1371 ptvWait->tv_usec = time_left_us % rtc::kNumMicrosecsPerSec;
1372 }
1373 }
1374 }
1375
1376 return true;
1377}
1378
1379#if defined(WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL)
1380
1381void PhysicalSocketServer::AddEpoll(Dispatcher* pdispatcher, uint64_t key) {
1382 RTC_DCHECK(epoll_fd_ != INVALID_SOCKET);
1383 int fd = pdispatcher->GetDescriptor();
1384 RTC_DCHECK(fd != INVALID_SOCKET);
1385 if (fd == INVALID_SOCKET) {
1386 return;
1387 }
1388
1389 struct epoll_event event = {0};
1390 event.events = GetEpollEvents(pdispatcher->GetRequestedEvents());
1391 event.data.u64 = key;
1392 int err = epoll_ctl(epoll_fd_, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, fd, &event);
1393 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(err, 0);
1394 if (err == -1) {
1395 RTC_LOG_E(LS_ERROR, EN, errno) << "epoll_ctl EPOLL_CTL_ADD";
1396 }
1397}
1398
1399void PhysicalSocketServer::RemoveEpoll(Dispatcher* pdispatcher) {
1400 RTC_DCHECK(epoll_fd_ != INVALID_SOCKET);
1401 int fd = pdispatcher->GetDescriptor();
1402 RTC_DCHECK(fd != INVALID_SOCKET);
1403 if (fd == INVALID_SOCKET) {
1404 return;
1405 }
1406
1407 struct epoll_event event = {0};
1408 int err = epoll_ctl(epoll_fd_, EPOLL_CTL_DEL, fd, &event);
1409 RTC_DCHECK(err == 0 || errno == ENOENT);
1410 if (err == -1) {
1411 if (errno == ENOENT) {
1412 // Socket has already been closed.
1413 RTC_LOG_E(LS_VERBOSE, EN, errno) << "epoll_ctl EPOLL_CTL_DEL";
1414 } else {
1415 RTC_LOG_E(LS_ERROR, EN, errno) << "epoll_ctl EPOLL_CTL_DEL";
1416 }
1417 }
1418}
1419
1420void PhysicalSocketServer::UpdateEpoll(Dispatcher* pdispatcher, uint64_t key) {
1421 RTC_DCHECK(epoll_fd_ != INVALID_SOCKET);
1422 int fd = pdispatcher->GetDescriptor();
1423 RTC_DCHECK(fd != INVALID_SOCKET);
1424 if (fd == INVALID_SOCKET) {
1425 return;
1426 }
1427
1428 struct epoll_event event = {0};
1429 event.events = GetEpollEvents(pdispatcher->GetRequestedEvents());
1430 event.data.u64 = key;
1431 int err = epoll_ctl(epoll_fd_, EPOLL_CTL_MOD, fd, &event);
1432 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(err, 0);
1433 if (err == -1) {
1434 RTC_LOG_E(LS_ERROR, EN, errno) << "epoll_ctl EPOLL_CTL_MOD";
1435 }
1436}
1437
1438bool PhysicalSocketServer::WaitEpoll(int cmsWait) {
1439 RTC_DCHECK(epoll_fd_ != INVALID_SOCKET);
1440 int64_t tvWait = -1;
1441 int64_t tvStop = -1;
1442 if (cmsWait != kForever) {
1443 tvWait = cmsWait;
1444 tvStop = TimeAfter(cmsWait);
1445 }
1446
1447 fWait_ = true;
1448 while (fWait_) {
1449 // Wait then call handlers as appropriate
1450 // < 0 means error
1451 // 0 means timeout
1452 // > 0 means count of descriptors ready
1453 int n = epoll_wait(epoll_fd_, epoll_events_.data(), epoll_events_.size(),
1454 static_cast<int>(tvWait));
1455 if (n < 0) {
1456 if (errno != EINTR) {
1457 RTC_LOG_E(LS_ERROR, EN, errno) << "epoll";
1458 return false;
1459 }
1460 // Else ignore the error and keep going. If this EINTR was for one of the
1461 // signals managed by this PhysicalSocketServer, the
1462 // PosixSignalDeliveryDispatcher will be in the signaled state in the next
1463 // iteration.
1464 } else if (n == 0) {
1465 // If timeout, return success
1466 return true;
1467 } else {
1468 // We have signaled descriptors
1469 CritScope cr(&crit_);
1470 for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
1471 const epoll_event& event = epoll_events_[i];
1472 uint64_t key = event.data.u64;
1473 if (!dispatcher_by_key_.count(key)) {
1474 // The dispatcher for this socket no longer exists.
1475 continue;
1476 }
1477 Dispatcher* pdispatcher = dispatcher_by_key_.at(key);
1478
1479 bool readable = (event.events & (EPOLLIN | EPOLLPRI));
1480 bool writable = (event.events & EPOLLOUT);
1481 bool check_error = (event.events & (EPOLLRDHUP | EPOLLERR | EPOLLHUP));
1482
1483 ProcessEvents(pdispatcher, readable, writable, check_error);
1484 }
1485 }
1486
1487 if (cmsWait != kForever) {
1488 tvWait = TimeDiff(tvStop, TimeMillis());
1489 if (tvWait <= 0) {
1490 // Return success on timeout.
1491 return true;
1492 }
1493 }
1494 }
1495
1496 return true;
1497}
1498
1499bool PhysicalSocketServer::WaitPoll(int cmsWait, Dispatcher* dispatcher) {
1500 RTC_DCHECK(dispatcher);
1501 int64_t tvWait = -1;
1502 int64_t tvStop = -1;
1503 if (cmsWait != kForever) {
1504 tvWait = cmsWait;
1505 tvStop = TimeAfter(cmsWait);
1506 }
1507
1508 fWait_ = true;
1509
1510 struct pollfd fds = {0};
1511 int fd = dispatcher->GetDescriptor();
1512 fds.fd = fd;
1513
1514 while (fWait_) {
1515 uint32_t ff = dispatcher->GetRequestedEvents();
1516 fds.events = 0;
1517 if (ff & (DE_READ | DE_ACCEPT)) {
1518 fds.events |= POLLIN;
1519 }
1520 if (ff & (DE_WRITE | DE_CONNECT)) {
1521 fds.events |= POLLOUT;
1522 }
1523 fds.revents = 0;
1524
1525 // Wait then call handlers as appropriate
1526 // < 0 means error
1527 // 0 means timeout
1528 // > 0 means count of descriptors ready
1529 int n = poll(&fds, 1, static_cast<int>(tvWait));
1530 if (n < 0) {
1531 if (errno != EINTR) {
1532 RTC_LOG_E(LS_ERROR, EN, errno) << "poll";
1533 return false;
1534 }
1535 // Else ignore the error and keep going. If this EINTR was for one of the
1536 // signals managed by this PhysicalSocketServer, the
1537 // PosixSignalDeliveryDispatcher will be in the signaled state in the next
1538 // iteration.
1539 } else if (n == 0) {
1540 // If timeout, return success
1541 return true;
1542 } else {
1543 // We have signaled descriptors (should only be the passed dispatcher).
1544 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(n, 1);
1545 RTC_DCHECK_EQ(fds.fd, fd);
1546
1547 bool readable = (fds.revents & (POLLIN | POLLPRI));
1548 bool writable = (fds.revents & POLLOUT);
1549 bool check_error = (fds.revents & (POLLRDHUP | POLLERR | POLLHUP));
1550
1551 ProcessEvents(dispatcher, readable, writable, check_error);
1552 }
1553
1554 if (cmsWait != kForever) {
1555 tvWait = TimeDiff(tvStop, TimeMillis());
1556 if (tvWait < 0) {
1557 // Return success on timeout.
1558 return true;
1559 }
1560 }
1561 }
1562
1563 return true;
1564}
1565
1566#endif // WEBRTC_USE_EPOLL
1567
1568#endif // WEBRTC_POSIX
1569
1570#if defined(WEBRTC_WIN)
1571bool PhysicalSocketServer::Wait(int cmsWait, bool process_io) {
1572 // We don't support reentrant waiting.
1573 RTC_DCHECK(!waiting_);
1574 ScopedSetTrue s(&waiting_);
1575
1576 int64_t cmsTotal = cmsWait;
1577 int64_t cmsElapsed = 0;
1578 int64_t msStart = Time();
1579
1580 fWait_ = true;
1581 while (fWait_) {
1582 std::vector<WSAEVENT> events;
1583 std::vector<uint64_t> event_owners;
1584
1585 events.push_back(socket_ev_);
1586
1587 {
1588 CritScope cr(&crit_);
1589 // Get a snapshot of all current dispatchers; this is used to avoid the
1590 // ABA problem (see later comment) and avoids the dispatcher_by_key_
1591 // iterator being invalidated by calling CheckSignalClose, which may
1592 // remove the dispatcher from the list.
1593 current_dispatcher_keys_.clear();
1594 for (auto const& kv : dispatcher_by_key_) {
1595 current_dispatcher_keys_.push_back(kv.first);
1596 }
1597 for (uint64_t key : current_dispatcher_keys_) {
1598 if (!dispatcher_by_key_.count(key)) {
1599 continue;
1600 }
1601 Dispatcher* disp = dispatcher_by_key_.at(key);
1602 if (!disp)
1603 continue;
1604 if (!process_io && (disp != signal_wakeup_))
1605 continue;
1606 SOCKET s = disp->GetSocket();
1607 if (disp->CheckSignalClose()) {
1608 // We just signalled close, don't poll this socket.
1609 } else if (s != INVALID_SOCKET) {
1610 WSAEventSelect(s, events[0],
1611 FlagsToEvents(disp->GetRequestedEvents()));
1612 } else {
1613 events.push_back(disp->GetWSAEvent());
1614 event_owners.push_back(key);
1615 }
1616 }
1617 }
1618
1619 // Which is shorter, the delay wait or the asked wait?
1620
1621 int64_t cmsNext;
1622 if (cmsWait == kForever) {
1623 cmsNext = cmsWait;
1624 } else {
1625 cmsNext = std::max<int64_t>(0, cmsTotal - cmsElapsed);
1626 }
1627
1628 // Wait for one of the events to signal
1629 DWORD dw =
1630 WSAWaitForMultipleEvents(static_cast<DWORD>(events.size()), &events[0],
1631 false, static_cast<DWORD>(cmsNext), false);
1632
1633 if (dw == WSA_WAIT_FAILED) {
1634 // Failed?
1635 // TODO(pthatcher): need a better strategy than this!
1636 WSAGetLastError();
1637 RTC_NOTREACHED();
1638 return false;
1639 } else if (dw == WSA_WAIT_TIMEOUT) {
1640 // Timeout?
1641 return true;
1642 } else {
1643 // Figure out which one it is and call it
1644 CritScope cr(&crit_);
1645 int index = dw - WSA_WAIT_EVENT_0;
1646 if (index > 0) {
1647 --index; // The first event is the socket event
1648 uint64_t key = event_owners[index];
1649 if (!dispatcher_by_key_.count(key)) {
1650 // The dispatcher could have been removed while waiting for events.
1651 continue;
1652 }
1653 Dispatcher* disp = dispatcher_by_key_.at(key);
1654 disp->OnEvent(0, 0);
1655 } else if (process_io) {
1656 // Iterate only on the dispatchers whose sockets were passed into
1657 // WSAEventSelect; this avoids the ABA problem (a socket being
1658 // destroyed and a new one created with the same SOCKET handle).
1659 for (uint64_t key : current_dispatcher_keys_) {
1660 if (!dispatcher_by_key_.count(key)) {
1661 continue;
1662 }
1663 Dispatcher* disp = dispatcher_by_key_.at(key);
1664 SOCKET s = disp->GetSocket();
1665 if (s == INVALID_SOCKET)
1666 continue;
1667
1668 WSANETWORKEVENTS wsaEvents;
1669 int err = WSAEnumNetworkEvents(s, events[0], &wsaEvents);
1670 if (err == 0) {
1671 {
1672 if ((wsaEvents.lNetworkEvents & FD_READ) &&
1673 wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_READ_BIT] != 0) {
1674 RTC_LOG(WARNING)
1675 << "PhysicalSocketServer got FD_READ_BIT error "
1676 << wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_READ_BIT];
1677 }
1678 if ((wsaEvents.lNetworkEvents & FD_WRITE) &&
1679 wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_WRITE_BIT] != 0) {
1680 RTC_LOG(WARNING)
1681 << "PhysicalSocketServer got FD_WRITE_BIT error "
1682 << wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_WRITE_BIT];
1683 }
1684 if ((wsaEvents.lNetworkEvents & FD_CONNECT) &&
1685 wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_CONNECT_BIT] != 0) {
1686 RTC_LOG(WARNING)
1687 << "PhysicalSocketServer got FD_CONNECT_BIT error "
1688 << wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_CONNECT_BIT];
1689 }
1690 if ((wsaEvents.lNetworkEvents & FD_ACCEPT) &&
1691 wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_ACCEPT_BIT] != 0) {
1692 RTC_LOG(WARNING)
1693 << "PhysicalSocketServer got FD_ACCEPT_BIT error "
1694 << wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_ACCEPT_BIT];
1695 }
1696 if ((wsaEvents.lNetworkEvents & FD_CLOSE) &&
1697 wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_CLOSE_BIT] != 0) {
1698 RTC_LOG(WARNING)
1699 << "PhysicalSocketServer got FD_CLOSE_BIT error "
1700 << wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_CLOSE_BIT];
1701 }
1702 }
1703 uint32_t ff = 0;
1704 int errcode = 0;
1705 if (wsaEvents.lNetworkEvents & FD_READ)
1706 ff |= DE_READ;
1707 if (wsaEvents.lNetworkEvents & FD_WRITE)
1708 ff |= DE_WRITE;
1709 if (wsaEvents.lNetworkEvents & FD_CONNECT) {
1710 if (wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_CONNECT_BIT] == 0) {
1711 ff |= DE_CONNECT;
1712 } else {
1713 ff |= DE_CLOSE;
1714 errcode = wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_CONNECT_BIT];
1715 }
1716 }
1717 if (wsaEvents.lNetworkEvents & FD_ACCEPT)
1718 ff |= DE_ACCEPT;
1719 if (wsaEvents.lNetworkEvents & FD_CLOSE) {
1720 ff |= DE_CLOSE;
1721 errcode = wsaEvents.iErrorCode[FD_CLOSE_BIT];
1722 }
1723 if (ff != 0) {
1724 disp->OnEvent(ff, errcode);
1725 }
1726 }
1727 }
1728 }
1729
1730 // Reset the network event until new activity occurs
1731 WSAResetEvent(socket_ev_);
1732 }
1733
1734 // Break?
1735 if (!fWait_)
1736 break;
1737 cmsElapsed = TimeSince(msStart);
1738 if ((cmsWait != kForever) && (cmsElapsed >= cmsWait)) {
1739 break;
1740 }
1741 }
1742
1743 // Done
1744 return true;
1745}
1746#endif // WEBRTC_WIN
1747
1748} // namespace rtc
